name: apple production | apple | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15665/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of apples. The average yield from 2009 - 2012 is 40.8 t/ha. The data are representative for apple production in the United States used for the export market. Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 67-23-48 kg/ha. No organic fertilisers are applied. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 11.6 kg a.i./ha.;The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market. The export share of apples produced in the United States amounts to 9% of the global export (tonnage exported in 2010). The production system regarded in this dataset aimed at representing apples produced in the United States for the export market.;PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 2.5 (i.e. good quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

This activity starts with the nursery producing fruit tree seedlings, i.e. grafted young trees to be planted.

This activity ends with the waste treatment after the clearing of the orchard (rooting up the trees). The dataset includes all activities of a year in a year in the productive phase of the orchard including the establishment phase per year of lifetime (15 years, 1389), the clearing of the orchard including waste treatment. 
The establishment phase of the orchard includes tree nursery, soil cultivation, planting trees, sowing grass, installation of trellis system (posts and wires) and irrigation. Fertiliser and pesticide use in a year of the establishment phase is assumed to be half of the amount of a year in the productive phase.
The productive phase of the orchard includes machine operations, corresponding infrastructure, fuel use and sheds. Machine operations in the productive phase are: soil cultivation (mulching, mowing), fertiliser and pesticide application, harvesting and irrigation. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. At the end of the productive phase the orchard is cleared by rooting up the trees.

Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered.
The inputs of seedlings, fertilisers and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0124:Growing of pome fruits and stone fruits

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: If used, extrapolations are documented on the flow level.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: WFLDB Methodological Guidelines for the Life Cycle Inventory of Agricultural Products in the latest version, available at: http://www.quantis-intl.com/microsites/wfldb. Data sources: Data were categorised from level 0 (L0) to level (L4) as follows: L0 = estimate, proxy; L1 = statistical data (e.g. FAOSTAT); L2 = L1 adapted to crop and country; L3 = literature data or L1 resp. L2 data approved by experts; medium detailing (e.g. kg of total N-fertiliser); L4 = L3 data of higher detailing as L3 data (e.g. kg of a specific N-fertiliser such as Ammonium-Nitrate or Urea).In this dataset data were obtained for yield: L3; Fertilisers: L4; Pesticides: L4; Machinery: L2, Irrigation: L2. For information regarding the calculation of individual exchanges see supporting documentation WFLDB-Documentation.pdf.

On-farm transport: Yield (in tonnes) multiplied by the average distance from field to farm. The distance was obtained by extrapolation (modified MEXALCA approach). See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Machinery processes' (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).  Corresponds to 49.6tkm/ha.

See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Fertiliser application' for L3 and L4 data  (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).
Corresponds to 44.9 kg/ha

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'apple' is calculated to be circa 3.33E-03 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonium nitrate, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 6.67E-03 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description:
Calculated based on literature values or expert estimation: The total amount of nutrient (Personal written communication, Bill Easterwood , Yara, 2015) multiplied by the share of fertiliser type (Personal written communication, Bill Easterwood , Yara, 2015). See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Fertiliser application' for L3 and L4 data  (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).
Corresponds to 22.1 kg/ha
